intro: Thoracostachyum heyneanum, commonly known as the Mexican grass or the giant sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity and maintaining wetland habitats.
